definition: to become sworn brothers or sisters/sworn (brothers)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute

sentences.english: We were blood brothers - I was ready to die for him.
sentences.chinese: 我們是滴血結拜的兄弟，我甚至可以爲他而死。

sentences.english: Xiao Zhang and Xiao Wang became sworn brothers because of their affection.
sentences.chinese: 小張和小王因爲感情好而結拜爲異姓兄弟。

sentences.english: Blade suddenly proposed several times should be forced to complete the dedication to become sworn midfix.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒忽然間提議應將幾次被迫中綴的結拜之禮完成。

sentences.english: Lin Chong and Lu Zhishen were sworn brothers.
sentences.chinese: 林沖和魯智深是結拜兄弟。

sentences.english: Later, they decided to be sworn brothers and became more intimate than before .
sentences.chinese: 後來，兩人結拜爲兄弟，更是時時刻刻，形影不離。

sentences.english: Now we are Brothers Three, said the Pilgrim boy.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們是結拜三兄弟了，朝聖者男孩說。

sentences.english: According to an early tradition became his sworn brother.
sentences.chinese: 根據一條過去的傳統，他成爲他的結拜兄弟。

definition: to swear brotherhood
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
unexpected misfortune/unexpected accident/sudden death
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
to say good-bye/to bid sb farewell
to give one's heart to/to devote one's life to
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
fig. the man sings and the woman follows/fig. marital harmony
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
to marry
to tease/to poke fun at
adopted son
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
